questions.question: Which of the following statements is correct? The cones of the eye:

options.content: detect colour and are more sensitive to low light levels and to movement than the rods
detect colour and are less sensitive to low light levels but more sensitive to movement than the rods
detect colour and are less sensitive to low light levels and to movement than the rods
detect colour and are more sensitive to low light levels but less sensitive to movement than the rods

questions.question: The semicircular canals react to:
Paradoxical sleep refreshes the:

options.content: homeoneural systems of the body only

questions.question: With what is “Mode Error” associated?
The brain controls breathing rate based upon the:

options.content: the amount of oxygen required at the capillaries

questions.question: Why is it essential to ensure that the combustion heater is serviceable in an aircraft?

options.content: To prevent carbon dioxide poisoning and possible fire
To prevent carbon dioxide poisoning, possible fire or explosion

questions.question: Short-term memory (Working Memory) can be improved through:

The systolic pressure is higher than the diastolic pressure and the normal reading for a healthy person is 120/80.

High blood pressure can lead to strokes.

options.content: The above is false as the diastolic pressure is higher than the systolic pressure
The above is false as the normal reading is 250/90
The above is false since high blood pressure can lead to heart attacks

questions.question: The factor which most increases the risk of coronary heart disease is:
Tidal volume is the volume of air:

options.content: remaining in the lungs after the most forceful expiration
that can still be exhaled by forceful expiration after the normal tidal expiration
that can still be inhaled over and beyond the normal breath
inhaled and exhaled with each normal breath

1. easy to change

2. easy to comprehend

3. easy to recognize

4. resistant to correction

What is the relationship between personality, attitude and behaviour?

options.content: Behaviour is the outward result of personality and attitude
Personality is the outward result of behaviour and attitude
Attitude is the outward result of personality and behaviour
There is no relationship. Personality is derived from genes whereas behaviour and attitude are learnt

questions.question: The nose:

options.content: warms, dries and filters the air
cools, dries and filters the air
cools, moistens and filters the air
warm, moistens and filters the air

questions.question: Rain on the windscreen at night tends to lead to:

options.content: too steep an approach and the threshold appears to be more distant than it is in fact
too shallow an approach and the threshold appears to be more distant than it is in fact
too steep an approach and the threshold appears to be closer than it is in fact
too shallow an approach and the threshold appears to be closer than it is in fact

questions.question: One of the causes of Noise Induced Hearing Loss (NIHL) is:

options.content: long exposure to levels of noise in excess of 90 dB
a blow to the head with subsequent damage to the ossicles

questions.question: The vestibular apparatus consists of the:

options.content: eustachian tube and the semicircular canals

questions.question: The “leans” or somatogyral illusion can be caused by:

options.content: levelling or reducing bank following a prolonged turn

questions.question: To overcome disorientation in IMC conditions it is advised to:

options.content: keep the head as still as possible

questions.question: Our primary source of spatial orientation is:
Co-action is a form of cooperation that can be defined as:

options.content: working in parallel towards a common goal.
working in parallel towards separate goals.

questions.question: adapt in approximately ........ whereas the Rods detect ......... and adapt in approximately ..........

options.content: black and white 7 minutes colour 30 minutes
black and white 30 minutes colour 7 minutes
colour 7 minutes black and white 30 minutes
colour 30 minutes black and white 7 minutes

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?

options.content: Circadian Dysrhythmia is usually worse when travelling from West to East and 1 day”s recovery is required for every 1 hour of Circadian Dysrhythmia
Circadian Dysrhythmia is usually worse when travelling from East to West and 1 day”s recovery is required for every 90 minutes of Circadian Dysrhythmia
Circadian Dysrhythmia is usually worse when travelling from West to East and 1 day”s recovery is required for every 12 hours of Circadian Dysrhythmia
Circadian Dysrhythmia is usually worse when travelling from West to East and 2 day”s recovery is required for every 1 hour of Circadian Dysrhythmia

questions.question: Among the factors which affect night vision are:

options.content: age, cabin altitudes above 8000 ft, age, smoking and alcohol
age, cabin altitudes above 8000 ft, age, smoking and lack of vitamin C
age, cabin altitudes above 8000 ft, age, smoking and lack of vitamin D
age, cabin altitudes above 8000 ft, age, smoking and lack of vitamin B

questions.question: The twin objectives of Human Performance are:

options.content: knowledge of the limitations of the body and their significance in aviation
the safety and efficiency of the operation and the well-being of the individual
physical fitness and good decision making

a mix of status and role is the best way to constitute a flight crew

options.content: equalize the pressure between the outer and middle ear

equalize the pressure between the inner and middle ear
equalize the pressure between the tympanum and the inner ear

make sure that they are correctly oiled, cleaned and maintained
take a spare pair of contact lenses with you and ensure they are immediately available
take a pair of ordinary corrective spectacles with you and have them immediately available

Overlearning:

options.content: improves the chance of recall and makes the performance of a task more resistance to stress and is an important concept of aviation training
is a process which is discouraged in aviation training as it may lead to “Regression” in times of acute stress
is a process in training which is usually adopted in order to pass complicated concepts to a recipient of limited capabilities

questions.question: What happens to the Systolic blood pressure if peripheral resistance is increased?

options.content: Systolic blood pressure initially decreases and then increases

questions.question:
The pressoreceptors have signalled low blood pressure. The body”s response is to:

1. increase rate of breathing

2. increase cardiac output

3. increase heart rate

4. relax the blood vessels

5. decrease heart rate

6. tighten the blood vessels

options.content: higher CO<sub>2</sub> content than on intake
more oxygen content than on intake
less water vapour content than on intake
the same CO<sub>2</sub> content as on intake

2. altitude of the occurrence

options.content: all of the above are correct
all are correct except 3 which is incorrect

questions.question: Hearing through bone conduction:

options.content: bypasses outer and the middle ear
is no different from the normal hearing process

1. flying in IMC

2. frequently changing between inside and outside references

1. trains or practises regularly

2. knows how to manage him/herself

3. possesses all the knowledge associated with his/her aircraft

4. knows how to keep resources in reserve for coping with the unexpected
Once a mental model is constructed, there is a tendency to give:

options.content: undue weight to information that contradicts the model
equal weight to information that contradicts and confirms the mental model
frequent alterations to the mental model
undue weight to information that confirms the model
